author: Legal Correspondent
text:
The Supreme Court on Tuesday agreed to hear on February 2 an application by market regulator SEBI for appointment of a Receiver to take control of assets of two firms of Sahara Group to re-pay investors.

“There has been no development on repayment front during last three months. We need some interim order,” senior advocate Arvind Datar, for SEBI, told a Bench led by Chief Justice of India T.S. Thakur in an urgent mentioning.

Sahara Group chief Subrata Roy along with two other directors of Sahara companies, Ravi Shankar Dubey and Ashok Roy Choudhary, are in jail since March 4, 2014.

Earlier, the apex court sought a response from the group as to why a Receiver should not be appointed to dispose of their properties to arrange Rs. 36,000 crore to pay its investors.
title: Sahara: apex court to hear SEBI plea
